      • createKeycloakUser

        public void createKeycloakUser​(CustomerEntity customerEntity)
                        throws KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException,
                               KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                               KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                               KeycloakUnknownErrorException
        Description copied from interface: KeycloakServiceI
        Method creates a new keycloak user based on an customer entity.
        Specified by:
        createKeycloakUser in interface KeycloakServiceI
        Parameters:
        customerEntity - customer entity
        Throws:
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if keycloak user already exists
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error

      • updateKeycloakUser

        public void updateKeycloakUser​(CustomerEntity customerEntity,
                               java.lang.String currentUsername)
                        throws KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                               KeycloakUnknownErrorException,
                               KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                               KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException
        Description copied from interface: KeycloakServiceI
        Method updates existing keycloak user based on customer entity.
        Specified by:
        updateKeycloakUser in interface KeycloakServiceI
        Parameters:
        customerEntity - customer entity
        currentUsername - current username (email)
        Throws:
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing customer with same email
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized

        customerEntity - customer entity
        currentUsername - current username (email)
        targetCustomerPrivileges - customer target role

        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error

      • deleteCustomerByEmail

        public void deleteCustomerByEmail​(java.lang.String email)
                           throws KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException,
                                  KeycloakUnknownErrorException,
                                  KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException,
                                  KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException,
                                  NotAuthorizedException
        Description copied from interface: KeycloakServiceI
        Method deletes keycloak user by its username (email).
        Specified by:
        deleteCustomerByEmail in interface KeycloakServiceI
        Parameters:
        email - customers email (username)
        Throws:
        KeycloakEndpointNotFoundException - if keycloak endpoint was not found
        KeycloakUnknownErrorException - if there was any other keycloak error
        KeycloakUserAlreadyExistsException - if there is an existing customer with same email
        KeycloakUserIsNotAuthorizedException - if keycloak admin user is not authorized
        NotAuthorizedException - if the master admin user is tried to be deleted
